title: How do you manage metadata in cloud-native applications?

content:
Metadata is additional information that describes application components and data. Managing it is crucial in cloud-native environments as it supports observability, service discovery, and automated configuration. Its importance lies in ensuring application resilience and scalability, with use cases including microservices architectures and continuous deployment processes.

Core tools include configuration management tools such as Kubernetes ConfigMaps and Secrets, as well as service meshes like Istio, characterized by distributed storage, version control, and dynamic updates. In practical applications, metadata is used for service registration and runtime configuration adjustments, significantly improving system reliability and cross-service consistency.

Implementation steps are: using dedicated storage such as etcd; integrating CI/CD pipelines to inject dynamic configurations; monitoring metadata changes to ensure consistency. Typical scenarios include communication between microservices and automated scaling; business values include reducing errors, accelerating deployments, and enhancing security.
